intro: Lappula gansuensis, commonly known as the Gansu lappula, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of northern China. It belongs to the family Chenopodiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and succulent leaves adapted to dry conditions. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in semi-desert environments. It has a short life cycle and is an important species in ecological studies of desert flora. Its morphology reflects evolutionary adaptations to extreme environmental conditions.
